lines.text: All climates are the same for love.
Only gone down half an inch in two days. We'll be here for ten years at this rate.
Ha-ha! Cheer up, milord. We pay no rent. Mother Nature sets the table for us, and, fortunately, we have plenty of water.
Ridiculous! Why should a shark want to swallow a bottle?
Ah, what was in his mind, I - I not know, I tell you only what was in his stomach.
I will discover your castaway shore, and you'll be a castaway no more. Oh, you'll be a castaway no more.
An earthquake of the first magnitude!
a crazy man who thinks he's smart, or a Frenchman who admits he's stupid.
The Lord helps them that helps themselves.
[uncovers a hidden rope]
Two years we took to make it. From the hairs of our heads, from the garments we wore, from a thousand things we gathered.
By Jove, that was a narrow squeak!
[ledge collapses underneath them]
Robert! Hold on!
I don't have to! She won't let go!
This is true. She will not let go until she reaches her nest.
Reaches her nest?
Yes. High in the mountains. No doubt she has little ones that must...
Oh!
[Paganel abruptly stops talking]
Oh!
By Jove, I never saw a rope burn like that.
Gun powder. It's woven in like a fuse.
First class shooting, Sir! First time, right through the heart.
No. Shoot through heart, bird go limp, drop small boy. But shoot back of head, bird go stiff, wings go up, he circle down, land boy safe.
You mean you purposely induced motor paralysis through damage on the medulla.
Not understand.
Neither do I.
My dear boy, if that's the way you feel about it, let's have a look at the blasted note. Where is it?
In the bottle.
Well, where's the bottle?
The Frenchman has it.
Confounded, where's the Frenchman?
You had him thrown off the ship in Glasgow.
Now you know my secret, why I ran away to sea. The voice is the voice of a god-fearing man, but the hands are the hands of a forger!

[as John starts to put his hand on Mary's shoulder]
Ah, there you are, my boy. Better get some sleep, you know. Got an early start.
We're too excited to sleep.
Hmm. So I see! You'd better come along with me, just the same.

[to Glenarvan while being moved to tears]
I must be catching your cold.

[sung]
Why cry about bad weather? Enjoy it! Each moment is a treasure. Enjoy it! We're travelers on life's highway, enjoy the trip. Each lovely twist and byway, each bump and dip. If there's a complication, enjoy it! You've got imagination, employ it. And you'll see roses in the snow, joie de vivre will make them grow. Voila, that's life, enjoy it! Since I must do the cooking, I'll enjoy it. This ombu tree smells gorgeous, you'll enjoy it. A hurricane comes your way, enjoy the breeze! You're stranded in the jungle, hah!, enjoy the trees! If there's a complication, enjoy it!
Ha ha ha!
You've got imagination, employ it. This tree's a - cornucopia, why it could be...
Utopia!
Voila! That's right! Enjoy it!
Why cry about bad weather? Enjoy it!
No, enjoy.
Oh, each moment is a treasure, enjoy it!
That's better, enjoy it.
We're traveler's on life's highway, enjoy the trip.
Ha ha ha!
Each lovely twist and byway, each bump and dip.
Good!
If there's a complication, enjoy it, enjoy it. You've got imagination, employ it, employ it. From eggs and herbs au naturel,
Omelette Ombu a la Paganel.
Pour vous, milord,
Enjoy it!
Much rain there. You sleep in tree. May come flood.
Flood! By George, that's a good one!
Giant ombu tree. Phytolacca dioica. Aha! Magnificent specimen!
Oh, *please*, may we sleep in it?
You can sleep where you like, but I certainly don't intend to roost in a tree like a confounded sparrow. Pitch my tent just here.
Merci merci merci beaucoup, merci milord Glenarvan!
[the group starts to dance around Glenarvan]
Merci merci merci beaucoup, merci milord Glenarvan!
Hooray!
Robert! Do you see anything of an Indian on horseback coming to our rescue?
Only some birds!
Only some... achoo!
Thank you, milord!
[kisses Glenarvan on both cheeks]
Oh, please! I'm an Englishman, you know!
Earthquake? Who said anything about an earthquake?
earth *quake*. This is the land of many earthquakes.
Oh gracious me.
In the whole world, no place has such big, such beautiful, such magnificent earthquakes as right here. But - huh-huh! - it is one chance in a million we should be so *fortunate*.

Heh-heh. Ye - Ye - Yes, of course, quite right. Besides, this place looks it's been here hundreds of years, doesn't it? I mean, uh, it's safe to assume that it will last one more night... *Hey*? *Oui*, monsieur?
Oui, milord.
And I'll wake you up if one comes, your lordship.
Flood come. You go quick to tree. I ride for help.
Not even raining.
[attempts to go back to sleep]
It's a tiger!
No no! It's a jaguar! Felis onca!
Get that beast outta here!
Anyway, I can't stand people who look at me like that. "*Delightful* child!" "*Gallant* father!"
A slight miscalculation, milord. I'm afraid we're on the wrong volcano.
Take your hands off me, monsieur. Never have I been thrown from any place in my life. Let's not set a precedent. Merci, monsieur, merci.

[singing with poor pronunciation]
Grimpons, grimpons, grimpons, grimpons, grimpons.
No, no. *Grimpons*.
Grimpons.
Let's climb. It is the French recipe for the good life. Whatever you want to do, don't be afraid to do it for fear of failure.
Now just a minute! Don't forget that it was me who arranged -
[Mary's kiss instantly silences him]
Thank you!
That's a fine thing. When I really want something, no one takes the slightest notice. If I happen to drop a casual remark...
Casual remark? "Throw him off the ship before I call the police! We ought to hang him from the yardarm!"
Good gracious, the Frenchman! I thought...
Oh, but I give you my word I was put off the ship. Heh! Fortunately, I do not let such things upset me. The note, milord.
My dear children, ever since I posted the reward for news of your father's ship, people have been turning up with notes they claimed to have found in bottles. How many is this, John?
Uh, twenty-two, father.
If I had my way, every last one of the culprits would be hanged from the yardarm. Exploiting human misery, that's what it is. Nothing more vicious, more... treacherous.
Ah, so this is the daughter of Captain Grant. Well, if I can reunite this delightful child and her gallant father, that is the reward I'm interested in.
Motley-looking lot of fellows you've got together.
Heh heh. Well, when you look for men that go into Maori country, you don't choose them from among the socially elite.
Heh-heh! Jolly well put.
Wait! I want to make a wish on that star.
What could *you* wish for that you haven't got?
That my father would go somewhere and get lost. Just for a little while, you understand.
If he hadn't put the note in the bottle, and if Monsieur Paganel hadn't caught that shark...
And if you hadn't tried to slapped my face that morning on the way to Plymouth, I wouldn't have talked my father into making this trip.
Funny how things work out, isn't it?
Here we are, all of us together.
All of us. Did you ever see so many stars?
Once, on top of a mountain.
Did you know that down there out of the light, you can see the Southern Cross?
Southern Cross?
[they stroll off, alone]

[watching the earthquake destruction through a telescope]
Oh! Oh, magnificent! This is an experience that makes our entire expedition worthwhile!

[sees an upcoming wall of ice]
Oh!
Abandon ship!
No, wait! There's a hole in the ice!
But we don't know where it goes!
We'll soon find out!
Oh... a giant condor. A Sarcoramphus gryphus.
Alpine type glacier, drift minimum.
We'll never get out of here... alive.
The ice melts and gets out, why can't we?
But Thalcave's different. He said "I bring help," and he will.
having you so happy you sing all the time, or so glum you won't even talk. "The ombu tree is gorgeous. Enjoy it!" Huh!
When we first met, I had a different impression. Most girls can be rather silly. Do you know what I mean?
No, I don't.
Well... you're different.
How different?
I don't know how to say it. I had it all worked out last night. Sounds rather silly now, though.
What does?
Well, you don't expect things of a girl, certain things like climbing mountains, going through floods, making the most of it. You know what I mean?
Don't think I do.
Well, I want to say that... I think you've been just *fine*... for a girl. Well, what I really mean is that - if we get out of here alive, and when we're old enough...
John?
Mary.
There's the log you've needed for your raft.
